portfolio_afterparty_description: Event photo management platform, with 4K storage, multiplayer, and built-in engagement features.
portfolio_godot_wry_description: Rust-based extension that integrates platform-specific webviews into Godot games (without extra dependencies).
portfolio_powershift_description: Field service management mobile app for utility workers with a web dashboard.
portfolio_ssn_description: A Minecraft server with no rules, a persistent map, and open-source plugins and configs.
portfolio_gachapon_description: It makes tiny happy noises when you're not paying attention...
newsletter_subtitle: I'll hit you up via email when there's a new post or when I've got something cool to share, no fixed schedule. You can unsubscribe whenever you want.
portfolio_afterparty_details:
I'm currently developing a platform for organisers to manage and share event photos and keep engaging with their audience even after the party is over.

• Uploaded images and videos are compressed with high quality and small file sizes.
• All processing happens on client-side, reducing server usage and costs.
portfolio_afterparty_media_dashboard: Dashboard for organisers to manage their photo albums (WIP).
portfolio_afterparty_media_mobile: Mobile view for a photographer's profile (WIP).
portfolio_afterparty_media_demo: Early product demo video for Afterparty.
portfolio_godot_wry_details:
A lightweight Rust extension that bridges native system webviews directly into Godot 4's scene tree. No Chromium bloat, no extra dependencies.

• Bidirectional JavaScript ↔ GDScript communication.
• Local resource serving via "res://" protocol for embedded webapps.
• Input event forwarding maintaining game/webview interactions.
• Cross-platform support leveraging each OS's native webview.
portfolio_godot_wry_media_docs: Godot WRY documentation's homepage running inside a Godot scene.
portfolio_godot_wry_media_simple_demo: Transparent webview integration within a Godot scene.
portfolio_godot_wry_media_cas: Live demo of a character creator UI made with Godot WRY.
portfolio_powershift_details:
Offline-first mobile app designed for utility field workers who operate in dead zones. Built with real-time sync, GPS tracking, and role-based dashboards that work without an internet connection.

• Background job queuing with conflict resolution for offline tasks.
• Real-time fleet management with geolocation tracking.
• Multi-tenant architecture supporting different companies.
• Data caching and syncing for usage without internet.
portfolio_powershift_media_mobile: Mobile interface for a squad shift start.
portfolio_powershift_media_dashboard: Dashboard showing status and details of a squad's shift.
portfolio_ssn_details:
Running Brazil's longest-standing anarchy Minecraft server with 5+ years of a persistent world. Zero rules, infinite world, and a fully open-source plugin ecosystem.

• Custom authentication system enabling cracked client access.
• Persistent world with 317GB+ of player-generated content since 2020.
• Open-source plugin architecture with community contributions.
• Optimizations supporting 4,400+ unique players.
portfolio_powershift_media_mobile_data: Data tab for debugging on mobile.
portfolio_powershift_media_devlog: I send dev update videos like this periodically for my freelance clients so they can see their project actually coming to life.

speaker_info_subtitle: You can use the following information to present me:
name: Name
my_minibio: A unicorn developer, designer, and DJ. Builds tools with Rust & Svelte, maintains open-source projects, and spin DJ sets on weekends.
about_me_subtitle: Me talking about me... just for you!
dislikes_networking: Networking for the sake of it
personally_intro: Hi, I'm Doce Fernandes. A curious, nice and queer person from the countryside of Minas Gerais. I lived in São Paulo for a year and now I'm based in Belo Horizonte. Leaving the countryside, facing São Paulo and then trying to make sense of myself somewhere in between was wild... in a good way, I think...
personally_work: I make my living as a Frontend Developer at {companyName}, where I get to build actually cool stuff and have the means to experiment with more than just the web, which is great.
personally_early_days: My programming journey started in 2015 with VB.NET, which feels like a lifetime ago. From there it was this whole chaotic path through random projects until eventually landing my first actual job in 2018.
personally_hobbies: When I'm not coding (rare), you'll find me looking for vinyl records, fighting against Fruity Loops, or chilling in the voice chat. I'm obsessed with hyperpop and more experimental music, especially the local scene, and I love mixing Brazilian Funk with other electronic sounds.
map_distance: I'm from Belo Horizonte, Brazil, roughly {km}km away from your current location, according to your IP address.
music_taste_subtitle: I would say my taste is a bit all over the place... So let me fetch my Last.fm data to tell you about it instead.
about_dj_subtitle: Sometimes I try making my own music. I still don't quite have the skills to make what I envision, but it's fun anyways.
lets_have_fun_description: Don't be shy! I'm everywhere online (footer has the links) but active the most on Discord. I'm always excited to meet new humans. Just please don't send a plain "hey" and nothing else, give me something to work with lol.
map_distance_fallback: I'm from Belo Horizonte, Brazil! I wonder where you're from...
ai_usage_subtitle: This page is my AI manifesto.
ai_usage_description:
Everything you're seeing on this site, I made it. The code, the design, the writing, all of it. It comes from things I learned messing around, emotions I felt, and ideas I really wanted to bring to life.

I do lightly use AI as a tool. Not to generate content, but only to proofread and translate my writing. The creative part, the actual stuff, that comes straight from my head and my whims. I also choose not to use tools like Copilot, just as a personal choice.

This site isn't exactly a portfolio, even though it kinda acts like one. It's more like my personal playground. I break stuff to understand them, and I leave things broken because I wanna code them at my own pace and in my own way.

And while we're at it... AI-generated art and music just don't do it for me. I'm not into soulless generated slop.

I like my stuff human :)

analytics_description:
This site uses Plausible to get an approximate number of visitors, fully anonymously. No identifiable information about you or your requests is ever stored. All data is anonymized and aggregated.

Plausible doesn't use cookies and is fully compliant with 🇪🇺 GDPR, 🇺🇸CCPA, 🇬🇧 PECR and 🇧🇷 LGPD.

Learn more about Plausible's dedication to privacy.
ai_usage_summary:
Everything you see here was made by me. The code, the design, the writing, everything. I do lightly use LLMs and AI as a tool.

Please read my AI manifesto.
design_description: I used {technology} for designing this website.
overall_design_description: I experimented A LOT until I finally decided to go with the design you are currently seeing.
overall_design_details:
I wanted the visuals to be quite simplistic but also be clearly well made and thought through. I think rounded corners are oversaturated, so I decided to make them very small. I moved from purple to green to match the brand I'm building as a DJ. Pitch black + green also makes it look so hackery and I love that, honestly...

I'm also actively trying to use less boxes. It bothers me that web designs are so boxy. Everything is inside a box. This is still true for my website, but you can notice how the elements on the hero on my home page are placed almost randomly or organically. Below it, my projects are also very much not inside a card. This is a constant work in progress of thinking outside the box... literally.
key_principles_description:
It shouldn't be too different than previous design. I had a lot of friends and internet strangers give me a lot of compliments on my previous design, so I didn't want to change it too much. So the structure, at least of the home page and navbar, was kept very similar, but with a very different coat of paint.

It should be more of a personal website than a portfolio. I want to make sure that this site is always more of my space on the internet than a CV. I still really wanted to better highlight my projects tho, because I'm working on stuff I'm really proud of and want to make it more clear that I work with more than just the web.

It should be fun. Something I always loved about my website was hiding easter eggs and fun interactions. It feels me with joy when someone find those for the first time. So this should never be lost in the new design.
pages_vs_blog_posts_description:
When looking for inspiration on the website of other developers, it always bothers me that most of them is almost purely just text. All of those pages could just be a blog post. Which isn't a problem at all, it just doesn't fit my vibe.

So I want to always make sure that my site pages are always very distinctive from mere blog pages. They should be very illustrated.
previous_versions_description: Since 2021, huh? It has been quite sometime since I don't nuke my website and rebuild it from the ground up... that's an accomplishment!
previous_versions_v2022: 2022 is when I fully rebranded myself. This reflected in some small design changes. Most notably, the super rounded corners, a bit less purple and accessibility improvements.
previous_versions_v2021: This was the very first design of this very website. I used a different name at the time and used this site more as a CV.

error_think_its_a_bug_description: If you believe you shouldn't be seeing this page right now, you can open an issue on GitHub. That would be quite helpful, really.
error_what_is_that_description: When a browser requests a website, the website will always respond with an HTTP status code like "404 Not Found" or "200 OK".
status_3xx_culprit: Hold on while I take you there...
status_204_description: Wait... if you're reading this... but there's no content... then who's driving the bus?
status_205_description: Can you reset the document, pretty please?
status_301_description: This page is my new home :D
status_304_description: Nothing changed while you weren't looking. Promise.
status_308_description: This page is my new home (also please use the same HTTP method) :D
status_400_description: I literally have no idea what you just asked for.
status_401_description: You skipped the whole login part. Try doing that first maybe?
status_402_description: Sorry but this one costs money. I don't make the rules (I do).
status_404_description: This page doesn't exist. How did you even get here?
status_405_description: Okay but why would you even try doing that?
status_406_description: Not accepting that. I have standards (barely).
status_407_description: Who even sent you? Really, something is wrong with that proxy.
status_408_description: You took too long and I got distracted. Try again maybe?
status_409_description: You're trying to do a thing, but someone already did that thing, sooo...
status_410_description: This isn't a 404. I know it existed. That's the scary part.
status_411_description: How long is it? Like, literally. I need numbers.
status_412_description: Whatever conditions you thought were true? They weren't.
status_413_description: That file was way too big. And this site doesn't even support file uploads???
status_414_description: Your URL is too long. Like way too long.
status_415_description: I don't know how to open that file, I'm afraid.
status_416_description: You asked for a slice that doesn't even exist.
status_418_description: Why are you asking for anything other than tea from a teapot, anyway?
status_420_description: The server is lying on the floor listening to Lorde right now. Give it space.
status_421_description: You're talking to the wrong server, babe.
status_422_description: Yeah yeah yeah, I get that... still not doing it.
status_425_description: I haven't had caffeine, serotonin, or attention yet. Come back later.
status_426_description: You need to update your setup. This ain't gonna work.
status_428_description: You were supposed to send a condition first...?
status_429_description: Okay but like... what if we just didn't do that right now?
status_431_description: I ain't reading all that. I'm happy for you tho. Or sorry that happened.
status_451_description: I can't show you this for legal reasons. Don't ask.
status_500_description: Something broke and it's probably my fault and that's literally all I know.
status_501_description: I don't know how to do that. Like at all. Literally never learned.
status_502_description: Got a bad response from the gateway. Not pointing fingers but like... yikes.
status_503_description: I'm taking a break. For pratical purposes, I don't exist.
status_504_description: My gateway ghosted me. I know you have nothing to do with this, but I just can't right now.
status_505_description: I don't speak that HTTP version, what browser are you even using?
status_506_description: This request tried to negotiate with itself and got stuck in a loop.
status_unknown_description: You typed in an HTTP response that doesn't even exist, what were you expecting???
gachapon_item_description_snack: Just one bite in, there's plenty left still.
gachapon_item_description_pin_button: Small, loud, and packed with love.
gachapon_item_description_fidget_spinner: Yes, you can spin it. That's literally the whole point.
